alert.note: Alert for Greene; Pickens; Sumter (Alabama) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued January 26 at 8:20PM CST until January 29 at 10:00PM CST by NWS Birmingham
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Alabama... Tombigbee River At Bevill Lock and Dam affecting Pickens, Greene and Sumter Counties. Tombigbee River At Gainesville Lock and Dam affecting Marengo, Greene and Sumter Counties. Tombigbee River At Demopolis Lock and Dam affecting Marengo, Greene, Hale and Sumter Counties. .Flooding continues on the Tombigbee River and flood warnings remain in effect. The next statement will be issued Saturday morning, or sooner if conditions warrant. && ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL LATE MONDAY EVENING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Tombigbee River at Bevill Lock and Dam. * WHEN...Until late Monday evening. * IMPACTS...At 122.0 feet, Cattle in low-lying areas of Southern Pickens County should be moved to higher ground. Cattle are cutoff in lowlands of Southern Pickens County at stages above 122 feet. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 7:00 PM CST Friday the stage was 122.4 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 7:00 PM CST Friday was 123.8 feet. - Forecast...The river will fall below flood stage late this evening to 120.6 feet early tomorrow afternoon. It will then rise above flood stage early Sunday morning to 122.5 feet Sunday evening. It will fall below flood stage again late Monday morning. - Flood stage is 122.0 feet. &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
